Title: Microsoft Outlook: Enhanced search experience with Copilot in Classic Outlook
Description: Classic Outlook will gain a Copilot side pane showing LLM-generated summaries of search results from documents and Teams messages. Users with a Copilot license can interact and ask follow-up questions. The feature rolls out from mid-December 2025 to mid-February 2026, enabled by default with AI content opt-in.
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact

Title: (Updated) Build and analyze surveys with Surveys Agent in Microsoft 365 Copilot
Description: Surveys Agent in Microsoft 365 Copilot enables users to create, distribute, and analyze surveys via chat using Microsoft Forms. Public preview starts mid-August 2025, with general availability by early November 2025. The feature is off by default and requires admin setup and licensing.

Title: (Updated) Microsoft 365 Copilot: Updates to memory and personalization
Description: Microsoft 365 Copilot updates Memory to personalize responses using chat history, with refreshed user controls for managing Saved Memory. Rollout begins October 2025, completing by mid-November. Existing settings remain respected, no admin action required unless updating documentation. Users gain more tailored, contextual AI interactions.
Tags: Updated message, Feature update, User impact, Admin impact

Title: (Updated) Microsoft 365 Copilot: Teams channels available in Context IQ prompts
Description: Microsoft 365 Copilot will integrate Teams channels into Context IQ prompts, allowing users to search and insert relevant channels they have access to. Rollout begins early November 2025, enabled by default, requiring no admin action. Users should be notified and documentation updated accordingly.
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact

Title: (Updated) Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Skills agent now available in Frontier
Description: The Skills agent, powered by People Skills, is now available in Frontier for early Microsoft 365 Copilot access, helping identify and develop skills across Teams, Surface, and Web. Admins can manage deployment via the Copilot Control center. Rollout began September 2025 but is paused for now.
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact

Title: (Updated) Introducing Knowledge Agent (preview): AI-powered content optimization for SharePoint and Copilot
Description: Knowledge Agent is a new SharePoint AI feature preview starting September 2025, offering role-based content optimization and intelligent actions via a floating button. It requires Microsoft 365 Copilot licenses for ready-made agents, changes agent access and icons, and allows admins to manage opt-in/out per site.
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact

Title: (Updated) Microsoft 365 Copilot: Agent Mode available in Excel Labs add-in (Frontier preview)
Description: Microsoft 365 Copilot's Agent Mode in Excel Labs (Frontier preview) enables natural language workbook editing, available from October 21, 2025, for Frontier program customers. Admins must enable Frontier access; users can toggle features in Copilot. More features and languages are coming, with no identified compliance issues.
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Product: Microsoft 365 for the web, Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365)

Title: Microsoft 365 Copilot: Edit in Outlook from Copilot Chat
Description: Microsoft 365 Copilot introduces an "Edit in Outlook" button for drafting emails from Copilot Chat prompts. Available to all licensed users across multiple platforms, it opens Outlook with a pre-filled draft. Rollout starts late October 2025, requires no extra licenses or admin changes, and is enabled by default.
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact

Title: (Updated) Rewrite with Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat coming soon to Edge for Business users
Description: Microsoft Edge for Business will add the Rewrite feature powered by Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat, enabling AI-assisted text drafting and rephrasing via right-click. Rollout starts December 2025, enabled by default, with admin control via InlineComposeEnabled policy and DLP restrictions affecting functionality.
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact

Title: GPT-5 becomes the default Copilot model
Description: GPT-5 will become the default Microsoft 365 Copilot model in a phased rollout from October to November 2025. Initially, users can toggle GPT-5 on or off; later, it becomes mandatory with no opt-out. GPT-5 offers faster, more accurate responses with dynamic model routing and reasoning features.

Title: (Updated) Microsoft Copilot in PowerPoint: Reference a Microsoft Teams meeting when creating a presentation with Copilot
Description: Microsoft Copilot in PowerPoint will allow users to reference Microsoft Teams meetings when creating presentations starting mid-January 2026. A Microsoft 365 Copilot license is required. The feature will roll out automatically on Windows, Mac, and web with no admin action needed.
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact

Title: (Updated) Microsoft Teams: Channel Agent
Description: Microsoft Teams introduces Channel Agent, an AI-powered assistant for each channel that summarizes conversations, manages tasks via Planner, and answers questions. EDU tenants have agent auto-creation off by default from October 20, 2025. It requires specific licenses and has limitations like no support for private channels or guest users. Admins can manage auto-creation settings in the Teams Admin Center. The feature rolls out in public preview from mid-September to mid-October 2025.
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact

Title: Microsoft Copilot Studio: Copy an agent from the lite experience into the full experience
Description: Users can now copy agents from the lite Copilot Studio into the full experience, gaining advanced authoring, publishing, lifecycle, and governance features. Rollout starts November 2025. Admins should prepare by managing environments, licensing, security policies, and governance via the Power Platform admin center.
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact

Title: Microsoft 365 admin center: Capacity pack support for SharePoint agent and Copilot tuning
Description: Microsoft 365 admin center will introduce Capacity Pack support for SharePoint Agents and Copilot Tuning in late October 2025, allowing prepaid message bundles to manage costs before pay-as-you-go charges. Admins can allocate packs, monitor usage in PPAC, and control environments via Entra ID. No prior action needed.

Title: Microsoft 365 Copilot: Session persistence enhancement for Copilot chat
Description: Microsoft 365 Copilot chat will preserve conversations by creating session entries in the navigation pane when a prompt is submitted, allowing users to return without losing progress. This update rolls out globally from October to November 2025, requires no admin action, and improves chat continuity.
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact

Title: (Updated) New request and approval experience for Microsoft agents in the Microsoft 365 admin center
Description: Microsoft 365 is introducing a new request and approval experience for Microsoft-built agents in the admin center, allowing centralized management of access requests via the Copilot > Agents & connectors page. Rollout starts late October 2025 and completes mid-November 2025, with no setup required.

Title: (Updated) Microsoft Teams: AI workflows powered by Microsoft 365 Copilot
Description: AI Workflows in the Teams Workflows app use Microsoft 365 Copilot to automate tasks via scheduled prompts and templates, available to licensed users. Rolling out late 2025 to early 2026, the feature is off by default and requires enabling the Workflows app in Teams. Admin controls allow disabling it.
Tags: Updated message, Feature update, User impact, Admin impact

Title: (Updated) Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Use Copilot with OneDrive files in File Explorer and Activity Center
Description: Microsoft 365 Copilot is integrated into Windows File Explorer and OneDrive Activity Center, allowing users to summarize documents, generate FAQs, compare files, and ask questions about OneDrive files. The feature rolls out globally by mid-November 2025, is on by default, and requires no admin setup.
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact

Title: (Updated) Microsoft 365 Copilot can generate an audio overview of documents, meetings, and files
Description: Microsoft 365 Copilot can generate podcast-style audio overviews of documents, meetings, and files in OneDrive, Teams, Word, and Copilot Notebooks starting May 2025 (English only). Users can customize speaker style and length. Features roll out through 2025 and require a Copilot license.
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact
